results.title: Our children : Video package
results.creator_credit: Rachel Dixon, Film Victoria and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A Child Protection Package to train professionals who are in regular contact with children. Divided into 5 segments: 1: Defining abuse 2:Difficulties in reporting 3:Early detection and support 4:Networking for information exchange and case management 5:On-going responsibility for prevention, protection and support between family, CSV and professionals. Accompanied by 43p. Leader’s Guide including 8 overhead transparencies. The Leader’s Guide should be used in conjunction with the video. It gives background information as well as discussion questions and issues relevant to each segment.

results.title: Otway countdown
results.creator_credit: John Bird, Don Dennett and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A student production making a clear statement of the conservationists viewpoint of clearfelling and woodchopping of valuable native forests. It examines the history of the Otways and argues strongly against current practices. This film could be used in conjunction with films and resources giving the alternative viewpoints to stimulate debate on resource management.

results.title: Ottawa, today and tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Planning experts redesigning Ottawa consider its potentialities as a national capital. Animation shows how it began as a lumbering town at the junction of three rivers. Points out some of its undesirable features and shows the master plan embodying good town-planning principles and highlighting its scenic waterways, drives, and Houses of Parliament.

results.title: Day of the dead (D)
results.creator_credit: George A. Romero, Richard Rubinstein, Laurel Productions and United Film Distribution Company
results.brief_description: The third and bleakest of George A. Romero’s ‘Living dead’ series (which consist of ‘Night of the living dead’ and ‘Dawn of the dead’), is also the most goriest. Essentially, society has collapsed and the living dead have taken over the world. The film picks up on a small group of survivors, made up of scientists and a small band of soldiers who have barricaded themselves in an abandoned missile silo. The scientists desperately search for a solution to the zombie plague, while the military become increasingly agitated at their lack of results. Like Romero’s previous outings into the world of the undead, the varied groups are microcosms of human nature and not surprisingly, the most unpleasant characters in this film are not the zombies but the humans themselves. Cast includes Lori Cardille, Terry Alexander, Joe Pilato, Richard Liberty and Howard Sherman.

results.title: Day after day
results.creator_credit: Clement Perron, Fernand Dansereau, Hubert Aquin, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A look at life in a small paper-milling town in Quebec where most of the 6,500 inhabitants derive their livelihood from the one industry. Day after day the same work, the same hours, the same machines, the same product, until the entire routine of living becomes but a reflection of the dominant routines of the mill. The commentary is made up largely of fragments of thoughts which might be running through the minds of the mill workers - this is the film’s theme as it probes to the very core of company-town life. (Awards: Toronto, San Francisco, Montreal, Chicago, New York)

results.title: Dawn flight
results.brief_description: A dramatic story of a young glider pilot. In stunning aerial manoeuvers, tree-top chases, and pursuits through rocky canyons he is haunted by a mysterious super-pilot

results.title: Davy Crockett: king of the wild frontier
results.creator_credit: Norman Foster, Bill Walsh and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Davy Crockett was a legendary folk hero. Starring Fess Parker as Crockett, the hero fights alligators, battles an Indian Chief in a savage tomahawk duel and fights for freedom at the ill-fated Alamo. Accompanied by his friend George Russell, played by Buddy Ebsen, “Davy Crockett” is a daring adventure of drama, humour and excitement and will remain a colourful portrayal of the frontier.

results.title: David to the Rescue
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Micheline Charest and Ronald A Weinberg
results.brief_description: David is always ready to help his fellow creatures out of trouble - but that usually leads him into adventure. “David to the Rescue” - David goes to Italy to attend a sick Gnome child. Finding the healing flower is a challenge which only he can handle. “The Baby Troll” - A baby Troll is stuck on a rock in the middle of the river. David must call upon a friend to help save him.

results.title: Our fragile coast
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Examines the twin processes of erosion and deposition along the Victorian coast. These areas include Port Cambell, the Gippsland Lakes, Ninety-Mile Beach, and Port Phillip Bay. Sea-Beach poem by Judith Wright.

results.title: Our Dynamic Earth
results.brief_description: Live footage of earthquakes and volcanoes dramatises changes in the earth’s crust. Animation explains these events in terms of the theory of plate tectonics. Many of the plate boundaries are located in deep ocean waters and, in a submersible vehicle scientists explore an underwater ridge where two plates are drifting apart.
